name: Caleta Garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if you want luxury this is not the place for you. But if you want luxury you have to pay a lot more than this hotel charges.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

reviews.text: For the price it was exactly what was required. We booked self catering, over Xmas to escape to some decent weather.
reviews.title: Highly recommend - great value for money and Tony who provided the entertainment was excellent
great place to stay, cheap and cheerful
reviews.text: The one bed apartment was clean and adequately equipped. The kitchen had a two ring hob and microwave. There was a fridge, kettle, toaster and enough plates, pans etc.
The bathroom had a miniature bath with shower over and the living area and bedroom had plenty of storage etc.
reviews.title: benidorms out now,,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment was cleaned not quite every day, but nearly (including Xmas day) and clean towels half way through.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's get something straight here. If you want a particular hotel in a particular location and of reasonable quality, then you should book from the brochure in January, like we all did in the old days. If you're going to book last minute from some website or other then you have to understand that you might be getting other peoples ''leftovers''.
reviews.title: 1980's hotel but not 1980's prices

reviews.text: It was with this in mind that my wife and i booked the Caleta Garden Hotel, last minute and therefore, reasonably cheap.
reviews.title: worst hotel i've ever stayed in!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is one that might have been thought of as luxurious in the distant past but it is badly dated and pretty run down. The food is nothing short of appalling (We ate out several times despite being All Inclusive) The chef seems to think that by 'Blootering' everything in industrial strength garlic, it makes it more palateable. The choice was very limited and the vegetables in particular were cooked to little more than mush and were inedible. However when i complained, chef kindly offered to fry me some chicken, which arrived undercooked and led to us eating out again! No matter the age of the hotel, badly cooked food is just not acceptable.
reviews.title: Cheap, basic and good fun.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a studio apartment with an uncomfortable bed and no air con. However the room was spotless and we didn't see a cockroach all week. The towels were changed frequently and the staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar is often unattended as the staff have various other duties to perform around the pool or in the dining room, however they were very cheery and friendly. And Tony the entertainment manager is a right good bloke and he kept us all laughing with his mad antics.
reviews.title: Pay a little more money for a better hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as the hotel is concerned, you get what you pay for! We paid £175 for 7 days self catering with flights and transfers included... so we didnt exactly expect the Ritz. We had booked a 1 bedroom apartment, which was well equipped with a hob, fridge, microwave, kettle, toaster, pots pants etc. Everything you need to stay self-catering- and all were clean and nicely presented. The bed was a little uncomfortable for a young couple, as it was two singles pushed together but the sheets were clean and changed during the week twice. The towels were also changed and the maids did an excellent job of cleaning our apartment- which was at best, an absolute state! I agree the hotel is extremely outdated, broken tiles litter the floor, and a good lick of paint wouldnt hurt, but the general look of the building is fine for a cheap and cheerful holiday. The staff on the reception were for the most part very frienly, with only one young girl obviously deeming herself too good for the job. We hired a car through the help of a very friendly receptionist, and they were only too happy to offer maps and directions to places.
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful!

reviews.text: The problem with Caleta De Fuste is the audience it attracts through cheap hotels such as Caleta Gardens, the English pubs dotted everywhere are ghastly and an embarrassment to a pure-bred English girl such as myself. Stick to the local bars and you will get a real taste for Fuertaventuran life. I recommend the blues bar down the main strip, the barman is extremely friendly and many enjoyable (and very drunk) evenings were spent here. As far as food is concerned the restaurant (the name escapes me now) opposite the supermarket, and next to il fido is brilliant for Paella, and is a MUST try!
reviews.title: 3* I don't think so! Maybe 20 yrs ago very tired and run down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all this holiday was a welcome break for me and my boyfriend, and a cheap one at that. However, if you're looking for great night life and alot to do Caleta de Fuste is NOT the place for you. I can only speak for the place during low season, but it was extremely quiet, and could easily be boring if you arent as silly as me and my boyfriend.
reviews.title: very good hotel good value for money

reviews.text: Great if you're confident enough to hire a car and explore the entire island as we did, go buggying through the volcanos as we did, and hire bikes to explore the lagoons as we did, but a very boring place if you're looking to stay in the resort.
reviews.title: Nice, friendly, welcoming and clean

reviews.text: We are Two WEEKs into what was supposed to be a wonderfull winter break!
reviews.title: Very friendly budget accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel in january 2011 and I found it very boring !! If you are looking for a quiet holiday just sitting drinking all day then its perfect but as for the food - most people complained, pool was dirty, a few people were standing looking at the muck on the bottom and we couldnt believe the colour of the balcony doors / windows - absolute filth !!! The rooms were basic, clean towels, floors and beds every 2 days, so no complaints there. The drinks were great though. Nice beer, strong spirits and real coca cola etc.. We got what we paid for, and dont get me wrong , we did have a nice time but just a few things could have been improved. The pool table and air hockey table was unusable as was covered in muck. The entertainment didnt start till 10 pm and was a load of rubbish, we stayed 3 out of 7 nights for our evening meal (even though we were all inclusive).
reviews.title: January stay - quiet, cold boring and filthy - go elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was very quiet and weather was quite chilly. but what can you expect in january? I would never go back to fuertaventura and it definately isnt the place for kids. If you are elderly and just want to relax, drinking all day then this is for you.
reviews.title: good value hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a week here Feb 4 - 11th. We only used the hotel for a base to sleep and shower in so didn't use any of the facilites.
reviews.title: CENTRAL LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great
reviews.title: Excellent location, clean but basic...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleanliness is very good
reviews.title: Great location, Hotel not 3 star. No frills

aka: Caleta Garden Hotel Caleta De Fuste
